User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8.1.5) Gecko/20070713 Firefox/2.0.0.5 Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8.1.5) Gecko/20070713 Firefox/2.0.0.5 See the html below. The wrapper specifies max-height:270px and overflow:auto. When I click on one of the internal links to expand an inner div, the scrollbar gets shown, even though the height of the internal contents are less than 270px. The scrollbar is not shown if I change max-height to height.

Reproducible: Always Steps to Reproduce: 1. Create a wrapper div with max-height larger than the contents, and oveflow auto. 2. Have the inner content of the div expand by javascript, but still be shorter than max height. Actual Results: Scrollbar shown Expected Results: Scrollbar should not be shown if inner content is less than max-height
